trans-unit.source: Performs data manipulation operations at run time.

This class is exposed by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.DataManipulator"></xref> property of the root <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataManipulator"></xref> class.
Exports the data for every series stored in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> object that contains series data.
Exports data from one or more series to the <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> object.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be exported.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> object that contains series data.
Exports data from the specified series to the <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> object.
The series to be exported.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> object that contains series data.
Filters the data points in a series by applying a filtering rule to the specified data point values for comparison.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod"></xref> enumeration value that determines the comparison method for the filtering rule.
Can be <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.LessThan"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.EqualTo"></xref>, and so forth.
The value part of the filtering rule that is applied to the first Y-values of data points.
For example, in the filtering rule "<6", 6 is the value.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be filtered.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that stores the filtered data.
If the series does not exist, an exception will be thrown.
The data point value that the filtering rule is applied to.
Can be X, Y, Y2, Y3, and so forth.
Filters one or more series by applying a filtering rule to the specified data point values in the first series.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod"></xref> enumeration value that determines the comparison method for the filtering rule.
Can be <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.LessThan"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.EqualTo"></xref>, and so forth.
The value part of the filtering rule that is applied to the first Y-values of data points.
For example, in the filtering rule "<6", 6 is the value.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that store the filtered data.
The number of output series must equal the number of input series, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
The data point value that the filtering rule is applied to.
Can be X, Y, Y2, Y3, and so forth.
Filters the data points in a series, either by removing the specified points or by marking them as empty for the given date/time ranges.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateRangeType"></xref> enumeration value that represents a date/time interval, such as days of the week, days of the month, and so forth.
Determines the range over which the given elements will be filtered.
Specifies the elements within the date/time range designated by the dateRange parameter that will be filtered.
Can be a single value, for example, "7"; comma-separated values, for example, "5,6"; a range of values, such as "9-11"; or any variation thereof, such as "5,6,9-11".
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be filtered.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that stores the filtered data.
If the series does not exist, an exception will be thrown.
Filters the data points for one or more series, by either removing the specified points or by marking them as empty for the given date/time ranges.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateRangeType"></xref> enumeration value that represents a date/time interval, such as days of the week, days of the month, and so forth.
Determines the range over which the given elements will be filtered.
Specifies the elements within the date/time range designated by the dateRange parameter that will be filtered.
Can be a single value, for example, "7"; comma-separated values, for example, "5,6"; a range of values, such as "9-11"; or any variation thereof, such as "5,6,9-11".
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that store the filtered data.
Make sure that the number of output series matches the number of input series, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
Filters the data points in a series by applying a filtering rule to the first Y-value of each of the data points.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod"></xref> enumeration value that determines the comparison method for the filtering rule.
Can be <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.LessThan"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.EqualTo"></xref>, and so forth.
The value part of the filtering rule that is applied to the first Y-values of data points.
For example, in the filtering rule "<6", 6 is the value.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be filtered.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that stores the filtered data.
If the series does not exist, an exception will be thrown.
Filters one or more series by applying a filtering rule to the first Y-value of each of the data points in the first series.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod"></xref> enumeration value that determines the comparison method for the filtering rule.
Can be <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.LessThan"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.EqualTo"></xref>, and so forth.
The value part of the filtering rule that is applied to the first Y-values of data points.
For example, in the filtering rule "<6", 6 is the value.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that store the filtered data.
The number of output series must match the number of input series, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
Performs custom filtering on the data points in a series.
An object that implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.IDataPointFilter"></xref> interface.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be filtered.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that stores the filtered data.
If the series does not exist, an exception will be thrown.
Filters the data points in a series, either by removing the specified points or by marking them as empty for the specified date/time ranges.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that is filtered is used to store the modified data.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateRangeType"></xref> enumeration value that represents a date/time interval, such as days of the week, days of the month, and so forth.
Determines the range over which the given elements will be filtered.
Specifies the elements within the date/time range designated by the dateRange parameter that will be filtered.
Can be a single value, for example, "7"; comma-separated values, for example, "5,6"; a range of values, such as "9-11"; or any variation thereof, such as "5,6,9-11".
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be filtered.
Filters the data points of one or more series, either by removing the specified points or by marking them as empty for the given date/time ranges.
The filtered <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> objects are used to store the modified data.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DateRangeType"></xref> enumeration value that represents a date/time interval, such as days of the week, days of the month, and so forth.
Determines the range over which the given elements will be filtered.
Specifies the elements within the date/time range designated by the dateRange parameter that will be filtered.
Can be a single value, for example, "7"; comma-separated values, for example, "5,6"; a range of values, such as "9-11"; or any variation thereof, such as "5,6,9-11".
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
Filters data points in a series by applying a filtering rule to the first Y-value of each data point.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that is filtered also stores the modified data.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod"></xref> enumeration value that determines the comparison method for the filtering rule.
Can be <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.LessThan"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.EqualTo"></xref>, and so forth.
The value part of the filtering rule that is applied to the first Y-values of data points.
For example, in the filtering rule "<6", 6 is the value.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that is filtered.
Filters one or more series by applying a filtering rule to the first Y-value of the data points in the first series.
The filtered <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> objects are used to store the modified data.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod"></xref> enumeration value that determines the comparison method for the filtering rule.
Can be <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.LessThan"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CompareMethod.EqualTo"></xref>, and so forth.
The value part of the filtering rule that is applied to the first Y-values of data points.
For example, in the filtering rule "<6", 6 is the value.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
Performs custom filtering on the data points in a series.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that is filtered also stores the modified data.
An object that implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.IDataPointFilter"></xref> interface.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that is filtered.
Performs custom filtering on the data points in one or more <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref>, based on the points in the first series.
The filtered <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> objects also store the modified data.
An object that implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.IDataPointFilter"></xref> interface.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
Performs custom filtering on the data points in one or more series, based on the points of the first series.
An object that implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.IDataPointFilter"></xref> interface.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that store the filtered data.
Make sure that the number of output series matches the number of input series, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether points are filtered if they match criteria specified in arguments in the Filter methods of this class.
`true` if points that match specified criteria are filtered; `false` if points that do not match the criteria are filtered.
The default value is `true`.
Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether points filtered by the Filter or FilterTopN methods will be removed or marked as empty.
`true` if filtered points will be marked as empty; `false` if they will be removed.
The default value is `false`.
Filters all data points in one or more series except for a specified number of points.
The points that are not filtered correspond to points in the first input series that have the largest or smallest values.
The number of data points that the filtering operation will not remove.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that store the filtered data.
Make sure that the number of output series matches the number of input series, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
The data point value that the filtering rule is applied to.
Can be X, Y, Y2, Y3, and so forth.
`true` if the largest values are kept, `false` if the smallest values are kept.
Filters all data points in a series except for a specified number of points with the smallest or largest values.
The number of data points that the filtering operation will not remove.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be filtered.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that stores the filtered data.
If the series does not exist, an exception will be thrown.
The data point value that the filtering rule is applied to.
Can be X, Y, Y2, Y3, and so forth.
`true` if the largest values are kept, `false` if the smallest values are kept.
Filters all data points in one or more series except for a specified number of data points.
The points that are not filtered correspond to points in the first series that have the largest values.
The number of data points that the filtering operation will not remove.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that store the filtered data.
Make sure that the number of output series matches the number of input series, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
The data point value that the filtering rule is applied to.
Can be X, Y, Y2, Y3, and so forth.
Filters all data points in a series except for a specified number of data points with the largest values.
The number of data points that the filtering operation will not remove.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be filtered.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that stores the filtered data.
If the series does not exist, an exception will be thrown.
The data point value that the filtering rule is applied to.
Can be X, Y, Y2, Y3, and so forth.
Filters out data points in one or more series except for a specified number of points.
The points that aren't filtered correspond to points in the first series that have the largest first Y-values.
The number of data points that the filtering operation will not remove.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that store the filtered data.
Make sure that the number of output series matches the number of input series, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
Filters out all data points in a series except for a specified number of points with the largest first Y-values.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that is filtered is used to store the modified data.
The number of data points that the filtering operation will not remove.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be filtered.
Filters all data points in one or more series except for a specified number of points.
The points that are not filtered correspond to points in the first series that have the largest first Y-values.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> objects that are filtered are used to store the modified data.
The number of data points that the filtering operation will not remove.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be filtered.
Filters all data points in a series except for a specified number of points with the largest first Y-values.
The number of data points that the filtering operation will not remove.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be filtered.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that stores the filtered data.
If the series does not exist, an exception will be thrown.
Groups data using one or more formulas, for one or more series.
Series are cleared of their original data and used to store the new data points.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be grouped.
Groups data using one or more formulas.
The series that is grouped is cleared of its original data, and used to store the new data points.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be grouped.
Groups data for one or more series, using one or more formulas.
Output series are used to store the grouped data points.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be grouped.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that will store the grouped data points.
If a series does not exist, it will be created; if it does exist, it will first be cleared of all data before storing grouped data points.
The number of output series must equal the number of input series, or an exception will be thrown.
Groups data using one or more formulas.
An output series is used to store the grouped data points.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be grouped.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that will store the new data points created by the grouping operation.
If it does not exist, an exception will be thrown.
Groups data for one or more series, using one or more formulas.
Series are cleared of their original data and used to store the new data points.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The interval offset size.
The unit of measurement for the interval offset.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be grouped.
Groups data using one or more formulas.
The series that is grouped is cleared of its original data, and used to store the new data points.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The interval offset size.
The unit of measurement for the interval offset.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be grouped.
Groups one or more series, using one or more formulas.
Output series are used to store the grouped data points, and an offset can be used for intervals.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The interval offset size.
The unit of measurement for the interval offset.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be grouped.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that will store the grouped data points.
If a series does not exist, it will be created; if it does exist, it will first be cleared of all data before storing grouped data points.
The number of output series must equal the number of input series, or an exception will be thrown.
Groups a series using one or more formulas.
An output series is used to store the grouped data points, and an offset can be used for intervals.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The interval offset size.
The unit of measurement for the interval offset.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be grouped.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that will store the new data points created by the grouping operation.
If it does not exist, an exception will be thrown.
Groups the data points in a series by axis labels, using one or more formulas.
An output series is used to store the grouped data points.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
The input <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be grouped.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that will store the new data points created by the grouping operation.
If it does not exist, an exception will be thrown.
Groups the data points in one or more series by axis labels, using one or more formulas.
Output series are used to store the grouped data points.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
A comma-separated list of names of the input <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref>.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> that will store the grouped data points.
If a series does not exist, it will be created; if it does exist, it will first be cleared of all data before storing grouped data points.
The number of output series must equal the number of input series, or an exception will be thrown.
Groups data points in a series by axis labels, using one or more formulas.
Original data point values are cleared, and the series then stores the new grouped data points.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
The input <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref>.
Groups data points from one or more series by axis labels, using one or more formulas.
Original data point values are cleared, and each of the series then stores its new grouped data points.
A comma-separated list of one or more formulas to be used for calculating the grouped data point values.
A comma-separated list of names of the input <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref>.
Replaces the missing data points in one or more series with empty points.
Each series is checked for a given interval that is determined by the interval and intervalType arguments.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be checked.
Replaces the missing data points in a series with empty points.
The series is checked for a given interval that is determined by the interval and intervalType arguments.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that is checked.
Replaces the missing data points in one or more series with empty points.
Each series is checked for a given interval that is determined by the interval, intervalOffset, intervalOffsetType and intervalType arguments.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The interval offset size.
The unit of measurement for the interval offset.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be checked.
Replaces the missing data points in a series with empty points.
The series is checked for a given interval that is determined by the interval, intervalOffset, intervalOffsetType and intervalType arguments.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The interval offset size.
The unit of measurement for the interval offset.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object in which to insert the empty points.
Replaces the missing data points in one or more series with empty points.
Each series is checked for a given interval that is determined by the interval, intervalOffset, intervalOffsetType and intervalType arguments.
The series range that is checked is determined by the toXValue and fromXValue arguments.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The interval offset size.
The unit of measurement for the interval offset.
The starting point for the series range to be checked.
Uses the X-values of the data points.
The end point for the series range to be checked.
Uses the X-values of the data points.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be checked.
Replaces the missing data points in a series with empty points.
The series is checked for a given interval that is determined by the interval, intervalOffset, intervalOffsetType and intervalType arguments.
The series range that is checked is determined by the toXValue and fromXValue arguments.
The size of the interval checked for missing data points.
The unit of measurement for the interval parameter.
The interval offset size.
The unit of measurement for the interval offset.
The starting point for the series range to be checked.
Uses the X-values of the data points.
The end point for the series range to be checked.
Uses the X-values of the data points.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> in which to insert the empty points.
Sorts the data points of one or more series in the specified order.
The sort can be based on any available data point value.
This method performs an ascending or descending sort on data points in a series, and is based on the value that is set in the `sortBy` parameter such as "X", "AxisLabel", "Y", "Y1", and so forth.
Note that if multiple series are sorted, the series must be aligned, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
All series will be sorted using the specified Y-value from the FIRST listed series; that is, all data points, regardless of the series they belong to, are sorted based on the first series.
To sort points using a custom sort routine, use a different definition of this overloaded method.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.PointSortOrder"></xref> enumeration value that determines if the sort is ascending or descending.
A `string` value that represents the data point values to be sorted.
Possible values are: "X", "Y", "Y2", "Y3", "AxisLabel", and so forth.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be sorted.
Performs a custom sort on one or more series.
This method performs a custom sort on the data points in one or more series; the sort logic is defined by the `comparer` parameter.
Override and implement the <xref:System.Collections.IComparer.Compare%2A> method of the <xref:System.Collections.IComparer> interface, perform the comparison(s) and then return `true` or `false`.
The sort order is determined by the return value.
Note that if multiple series are sorted, the series must be aligned, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
The two object parameters of the <xref:System.Collections.IComparer.Compare%2A> method must always be of type <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint>.

All data points, regardless of the series they belong to, are sorted based on the first series; if the position of a data point in the first series changes, all corresponding points in the other series change as well.
An object that implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IComparer"></xref> interface and provides the custom sorting logic.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be sorted.
Performs a custom sort on the data points in a series.
This method performs a custom sort on the data points in a series; the sort logic is defined by the `comparer` parameter.
Override and implement the <xref:System.Collections.IComparer.Compare%2A> method of the <xref:System.Collections.IComparer> interface, perform the comparison(s) and then return `true` or `false`.
The sort order is determined by the return value.
The two object parameters of the <xref:System.Collections.IComparer.Compare%2A> method must always be of type <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint>.
To perform a custom sort for more than one series per function call, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataManipulator.Sort%2A> method.
An object that implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IComparer"></xref> interface and provides the custom sorting logic.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be sorted.
Performs a sort on the data points in one or more series, using the specified order.
The sort is based on the first Y-value of each of the data points.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.PointSortOrder"></xref> enumeration value that determines if the sort is ascending or descending.
A comma-separated list of names of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> to be sorted.
Performs a sort on the data points in a series using the specified order.
The sort is based on the first Y-value of each of the data points.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.PointSortOrder"></xref> enumeration value that determines if the sort is ascending or descending.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be sorted.
Performs a sort on the data points in a series using the specified order.
The sort can be based on any available data point value.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.PointSortOrder"></xref> enumeration value that determines if the sort is ascending or descending
A `string` value that represents the data point values to be sorted.
Possible values are: "X", "Y", "Y2", "Y3", "AxisLabel", and so forth.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object to be sorted.
